content.question:
Two scatterplots are shown.

Based on the scatterplots, which statement CANNOT be true?

choices.label: Plot A indicates a nonlinear relationship between the variables.
Plot B indicates a linear relationship between the variables.
The correlation coefficient for the data in plot B is close to <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The correlation coefficient for the data in plot A is close to <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The <math alttext="r squared" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> value of the least-squares regression line for plot B is greater than the <math alttext="r squared" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> value of the least-squares regression line for plot A.

content.answer: The correlation coefficient for the data in plot B is close to <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 2.4: Representing the Relationship Between Two Quantitative Variables

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
